intro: Plagiobothrys hirtus var. corallicarpus, commonly known as the coralfruit bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy stems and leaves. Its fruit, which is inflated and resembles a small bladder, is a distinctive botanical feature. The variety corallicarpus is distinguished by its unique fruit morphology and habitat preferences.
